data.name: Reverse maximal of minimal numbers
data.description:
~~~if:python
**You will get a lot of numbers and you will need to find the maximum 3. Then find the minimum number and turn it over**

## Example
`maximum_minimum_reverse([7, 3, 12, 2, "91", 17, 6])`

3 maximum is `[12, 17, 91]` ("91" converted to int)

minimum of `[12, 17, 91]` is 12

turn over (12 -> 21)

get sum of numbers (1 + 2 = 3)

if sum is odd, add normal number to the end (21 -> 2112)

remove the number in the middle (2112 -> 212, 1234 -> 124, 54321 -> 5421)

So, `maximum_minimum_reverse([7, 3, 12, 2, "91", 17, 6])` will return `212`

## Note
If one or more numbers are negative, return `None`
~~~
